WRITING.TEXT: I heard that if you poison them it will cause them to die. I'm about to test this myself because it kept happening to me too.

Nice, is there a new release of DolphinVR, or does the regular 5.0 do vr now?

As an American citizen, I would consider it.
He's not wrong.
Been happening to me to and it breaks my balls.

Got a newer friend who is an opthalmologist that I need to hit up. I read something about some people's eyes aren't equal distance from your nose and HMDs in the future will let you adjust them independent of each other.
After messing with it a lot, I'm convinced I've got it the best it can be. If its set up right you can clearly see the diagonal lines that make up the picture.
I'd seen this post earlier this week.. Maybe making it clearer would help the eye issue.

WRITING.TITLE: No matter what I do, I can't seem to get the IPD right
WRITING.TEXT:
Had my Rift for two months now and lately its been collecting dust because I always feel tension in my eyes when I use it. It feels like I'm going cross-eyed and the feeling lingers after I've taken it off.
I measured myself at a 63, and I can tell that I've got it set up optimally because it is the clearest possible. And I do get motion sick sometimes, but I can live with that. What I can't handle is worrying that I'm damaging my eyes. Now I'm not using it that often because its always the same result.
Thoughts?

So after 2 1/2 games we've learned the Cavs can shut down Curry.

I just creamed my pants.

I experienced a fair amount of eye strain that I did not expect with the CV1 when I first got it, to the point I still felt strained for a few days after using it. So that is my experience but I haven't tried the Vive.
